Save datasets during package development

Source: R/datawrite_to_local.R
datawrite_to_local.Rd

Utility to write large object(s) like EJAM datasets to local disk for convenience during app/pkg development, formatted as .arrow or .rda

Usage

datawrite_to_local(
  varnames = .arrow_ds_names,
  fnames = paste0(varnames, ".arrow"),
  localfolder = "~/../Downloads",
  justchecking = F,
  overwrite = FALSE
)

Arguments

varnames

vector of object names

fnames

optional vector of file names including extension ".rda" or ".arrow", but without path. Default is .arrow

localfolder

path to local folder without slash at end

justchecking

set this to FALSE to actually save instead of just seeing in console info or the commands to be used, to test/check this

overwrite

Set to TRUE to overwrite file if it exists already, with new copy.

Value

the paths of the objects as requested to be saved whether or not actually done

See also

dataload_from_local()

Examples

  x = 1
  datawrite_to_local("x", localfolder = ".", justchecking = T) 
#> 
#> 
#> Just checking, so nothing is being saved.
#> 
#> x is in memory?  FALSE ... The file is already saved in folder?  FALSE
#> 
#>
